channel.title: Events on Literati IITT
channel.description: Recent content in Events on Literati IITT

item.title: Standpoint 2K22 Freshers Edition
item.description: Summary: Debate and Oratory Club IITT comes back with Standpoint, our an annual exposition/public speaking event; Gear up for the first oratory event of this academic year and win exciting prizes worth up to 5000.

item.title: Indian History Quiz
item.description: Summary: As we celebrate 75 years of Indian Independence, the quiz club invites you to participate in the “Indian History Quiz”; There is nothing more fascinating than learning about our country in a fun filled manner.

item.title: Ease Your Pace
item.description: Summary: Weâ€™ve come up with a very simple writing activity (writing prompts, describing a scene and paradox thinking) that would serve as a great way to start your journey with literature.

item.title: Essay Writing Competition
item.description: Summary: On the occasion of the 400th Prakash Parab Samaroh of Shri Guru Tegh Bahadur Ji, the Literary Affairs Council is conducting a week-long essay writing competition.

item.title: Standpoint 2021-22
item.description: Summary: Debate and Oratory Club IITT comes back with Standpoint, our an annual exposition/public speaking event; Gear up for the first oratory event of this academic year and win exciting prizes worth up to 5000.

item.title: Have We Met Before
item.description: Summary: Literati (LAC) in collaboration with the Guidance and Counselling Unit (GCU) is elated to present ‘Have We Met Before’; An institute-wide interactive event open to all UG and PG students.

item.title: Essay On 'Aatmanirbharta'
item.description: Summary: The next year will mark a momentous milestone in India’s history, the 75th Independence Day; We have seen various changes throughout history, none more profound than the impact of technology.

item.title: Vaad Vivaad 2k21
item.description: Summary: We are thrilled to announce the first edition of the team debating event: Vaad-Vivaad; An event geared in a fun and general format to help students find their feet in the world of public speaking.

item.title: Standpoint 2020-21
item.description: Summary: As part of Republic Day Celebrations, Debate Club and LAC will be hosting our annual exposition/public-speaking event Standpoint; We hope to see active participation from your side!
